alert.note: Alert for Smith (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:28PM CDT until July 18 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR SMITH...SOUTHEASTERN DAVIDSON...NORTHWESTERN DE KALB... NORTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD...SUMNER...WILSON...MACON...TROUSDALE AND NORTHWESTERN CANNON COUNTIES... At 428 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Westmoreland to near Lebanon to Antioch, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Gallatin, Lebanon, Lafayette, Carthage, Hartsville, Nashville, Hendersonville, Smyrna, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Lakewood, Westmoreland, Watertown, Gordonsville, Red Boiling Springs, Hermitage, Walterhill, Rural Hill and Belinda City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 207 and 264. Interstate 65 between mile markers 82 and 88. Interstate 24 between mile markers 47 and 54. Interstate 840 between mile markers 58 and 76. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
